intro: Gymnosporia mekongensis, commonly known as the Mekong gymnosporia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces small, dry fruits called follicles, which contain the seeds. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland areas. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
